description: <p>Role:\xc2\xa0 Business Development and Channel Manager</p> <p>Location: Tokyo, Japan</p> <p>Department: Business Development</p> <p><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5KolSZQCnR4"><strong>"What would life be like without Elasticsearch?"</strong></a></p> <p><a href="https://www.elastic.co/webinars/sneak-peek-of-graph-capabilities-with-elasticsearch"><strong>\xe2\x80\x9cGraph Capabilities with the Elastic Stack"</strong></a></p> <p>At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects \xe2\x80\x94 Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats \xe2\x80\x94 we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to real-time Twitter feeds, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites 500+ employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.</p> <p>We are looking for a highly motivated BD &amp; Channel Manager to join our Business Development organization to cover partners in the Japan. This role is responsible for supporting Elastic\xe2\x80\x99s efforts to build an elite ecosystem of partners who are highly strategic to the company\xe2\x80\x99s long-term goals.</p> <p>The BD &amp; Channel Manager will recruit, enable, and support a network of partners in order to drive partner sourced, influenced, and fulfilled revenue. We want energetic, innovative, and results-oriented partner leaders.</p> <p>Location \xe2\x80\x93 Tokyo, Japan</p> <p>Responsibilities</p> <ul> <li>Identify, recruit, enable and manage partners (Regional SIs, VARs, referral partners, consulting firms) to support business goals and to execute partner sales strategies specific to each geographic region</li> <li>Drive consistent and predictable channel bookings through joint business planning and ongoing channel enablement</li> <li>Work closely with our direct sales teams on development, tracking, and reporting goals and objectives, forecasts, key metrics and definitions of success for each partner account</li> <li>Negotiate and close channel and partnership contracts</li> <li>Create and drive overall channel strategy and prioritization plan for coverage area, including the development of an Elastic Stack practice across priority channel partners</li> </ul> <p>Requirements</p> <ul> <li>Energetic, smart, self-directed, and passionate business development and channels professional</li> <li>Experience recruiting, enabling, and leading a network of SI and channel partners with direct personal involvement</li> <li>Experience building channel networks from the ground up</li> <li>Experience negotiating channel agreements and designing channel programs</li> <li>Demonstrated success growing the impact of channel results through increased lead growth or bookings growth</li> <li>Understanding of analytics, search, or big data markets / products or ability to learn quickly</li> <li>Willing to travel up to 30% of the time</li> <li>Bachelor's degree, Masters or MBA is a plus</li> </ul> <p>Additional Information</p> <p>We're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company with employees in 27 countries (and counting), spread across 18 time zones, speaking over 30 languages, we believe that diversity drives our vibe. Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life.</p> <ul> <li>Competitive pay and benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices</li> <li>An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life</li> <li>Passionate people building great products</li> <li>Employees with a wide variety of interests</li> <li>Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.</li> <li>Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages! Some even fly south for the winter :)</li> </ul> <p>Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.</p>

The Business System Team consists of people who have real passion for what they do and are masters at their craft. We reflect the larger company philosophy, to solve data problems, but focus internally on the systems we build and the internal partners we support. Agile in our processes, we strive to push the boundaries of our best-of-breed platforms to build a world-class systems operation. Our team thinks smart, strategic, and scalable, and will push you to do the same.</p> <p><strong>You Can:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Be a proactive collaborator regularly discussing business process and functionality improvements with key partners.</li> <li>Hold strategic conversations related to a NetSuite development roadmap considering technology dependencies, partner requests, business NetSuite Engineers and Administrators ensuring consistent quality of service, career development, constructive feedback, and mentorship.</li> <li>Be an integral part of a highly technical team with high expectations on their ability to deliver quality tools on a regular basis.</li> <li>Be phenomenal!</li> </ul> <p><strong>And have these qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills.</li> <li>10+ years of experience with the NetSuite platform</li> <li>5+ years managing a team passionate about developing and delivering quality scripted customizations on NetSuite</li> <li>Knowledge of and experience with Suite-Commerce Advanced, One-world, and multi-currency functionality within NetSuite.</li> <li>Work within a dynamic agile development environment, updating user stories, Kanban Boards, and epics to facilitate project progress and reporting.</li> <li>Experience with IT General Computing Controls such as logical access, change management, and operations found in security control frameworks (ISO, SOX, SOC2, etc).</li> <li>BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent work experience.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Bonus points for the following:</strong></p> <ul> <li>NetSuite Certifications</li> <li>Knowledge of Salesforce and Talend (or other integration platforms)</li> <li>Knowledge of the Elastic description: <p>Our business systems and tools keep the blood flowing through the Elastic organism - keeping it connected, happy, and working 24x7x365 across 32 countries. Our systems are critical to everything we do, every line of code we commit, every deal we close, every customer case we solve, every moment we share together over video. Elastic\xe2\x80\x99s future depends on evolving and innovating our systems to not just keep up with our people, but to lay down tracks ahead of them, anticipating what comes next. Our systems and the people that love and care for them are core to our success, and as the leader this team, you will be critical to that success.</p> <p>The perfect candidate for this role will be ambitious, well versed in the world of modern information technology and the demands of a sometimes nomadic workforce, and does not accept the status quo. You will be visionary in anticipating new ways to put the latest tools and capabilities into the hands of your internal customers in a controlled way, while being open to learning from your colleagues about even more amazing possibilities through their experiences in the world. You will wake up every day to new ideas of how to use our own Elastic Stack to further us along towards greatness. You will live in the future, always thinking ahead, while planning for the commonplace and the exceptional.</p> <p>In this role, you will be comfortable challenging and influencing senior leaders in the business, and thinking very strategically. Choices for the business will be made collaboratively using data and wisdom, but mostly data, balancing investment with return. You will be lead of a team of conscientious and skilled professionals, each an expert in their own domain. Maintaining the respect and trust your customers have for the team, as well as respect and trust within the team, is foundational.</p> <p>If you read this far and think that's me then you probably won't need to read any further and we should have a conversation. But if you are in any doubt the type of experiences we expect you to have then the following should help clarify;</p> <ul> <li>Strategic technology thinker who has successfully led and driven strategic change and transformation in fast moving organizations.</li> <li>Partners effectively with the senior leadership team, influencing thinking and executing decisions.</li> <li>Has a consistent record of building and managing world-class business applications, infrastructure tools and systems that scale.</li> <li>Strong experience with driving and delivering the overarching strategic visions of the company whilst simultaneously balancing immediate business priorities/projects.</li> <li>Knowledge and willingness to continually stay on top of the latest industry products and technologies, and be able to identify how new technologies can be integrated into Elastic to drive improvement, including the use of our own stack to solution internal needs.</li> <li>Focused on maintaining tight controls and compliance posture.</li> <li>Highly effective in building strong business relationships across all parts of the business through transparent, timely, and concise communications.</li> <li>Consistent track record of leadership of distributed high-performing teams, including growing and mentoring future leaders, maximizing all team members individual contributions and creating inspired work environments that support innovation.</li> <li>Leads by example and will not hesitate to roll up sleeves when needed with day to day activities.</li> </ul> <h2>Experience</h2> <ul> <li>Bachelor/Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in relevant area and equivalent work experience.</li> <li>Minimum of 10 years of experience leading a high-performing IT organization.</li> <li>Exceptional collaboration and influencing skills, specifically a demonstrated ability to effectively guide and influence within a dynamic environment.</li> <li>Background in high-tech industry, with depth of experience in cloud technologies and experienced building tightly integrated ecosystems.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Additional\xc2\xa0Information</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Competitive pay and benefits</li> <li>401K matching</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices</li> <li>An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life</li> description: <p>At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects \xe2\x80\x94 Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats \xe2\x80\x94 we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. Diversity drives our vibe. We unite employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.</p> <p>Innovation at Elastic never stops and we are excited to have just released Elastic APM in GA. The APM product is rapidly evolving and we're looking for a Senior UI Engineer to join the team as soon as possible and help build APM on the Elastic Stack.</p> <p>As a JavaScript engineer on the APM team, you'll primarily be working on the dedicated APM UI in Kibana. You'll be working with the UI team, product management and the server and agents teams on building a high quality, intuitive and innovative APM UI that supports multiple agents and programming languages.</p> <h4><strong>Engineering</strong> <strong>philosophy</strong></h4> <p>We believe that engineering complex, pluggable software for the web that is built to last the test of time is both tricky and exciting. Doing so requires a team of diverse individuals, with sharp minds and the ability to empathize with our users, working together with mutual respect and a common mission.</p> <p>We care deeply about giving you full ownership of what you're working on. Our company fundamentally believes great minds achieve greatness when they are set free and are surrounded and challenged by their peers, which is clearly visible throughout our organization. At Elastic, hierarchy does not determine how decisions get made. We feel that anyone needs to be in the position to comment on anything, regardless of their role within the company.</p> <h4>Responsibilities</h4> <ul> <li>Work on a new and exciting Elastic product.</li> <li>Develop the APM UI.</li> <li>Collaborate with fellow JavaScript engineers.</li> <li>Collaborate with product design, server team, agent engineers and the Kibana team.</li> </ul> <h4>Skills &amp; Requirements</h4> <ul> <li>Strong JavaScript programming skills</li> <li>5+ years of front end development work</li> <li>Experience with one modern MVC style JS Framework</li> <li>Experience writing automated tests</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast paced start-up environment</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills, a great teammate with strong analytical, problem solving, debugging and troubleshooting skills</li> <li>Strong preference for Open Source experience</li> <li>Ability to work independently</li> </ul> <p>#LI-MC</p> <p>Target Locations: Copenhagen, Barcelona, Amsterdam, London\xc2\xa0</p> <h4>Additional Information</h4> <ul> <li>Deeply competitive pay and benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices</li> <li>An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life</li> <li>Passionate people building phenomenal products</li> </ul> <p>Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.</p>
title: APM - Senior React / Javascript Engineer - Europe or US East Coast

description: <p>At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects \xe2\x80\x94 Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats \xe2\x80\x94 we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.</p> <p>The Beats platform is the basis for building open source shippers that collect all kinds of operational data, store it in Elasticsearch, and visualize it with Kibana. They collect data from edge servers, and are used to power application monitoring, infrastructure monitoring, and network monitoring. We currently have five official Beats: Filebeat for gathering logs, Packetbeat for network traffic, Metricbeat for metrics, Winlogbeat for Windows event logs, Heartbeat for uptime monitoring, and Auditbeat for audit data. In addition, the open-source community has created over 40 Beats, collecting data from all sorts of sources.</p> <p>All current Beats are written in Golang.</p> <p>As part of the Beats team, you will be responsible for maintaining the official Beats, for creating new ones, as well as for supporting the community around Beats. The team is diverse and distributed across the world, and collaborates on daily basis over Github, Zoom, and Slack.</p> <ul> <li>Write open source Golang code for maintaining different Beats.</li> <li>Dive into new technologies and figure out how to best monitor them.</li> <li>Define and create new Beats.</li> <li>Work with our support team to help customers.</li> <li>Answer community questions.</li> <li>Collaborate with other development teams, quality engineering team and documentation team to execute on product deliverables.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Skills you will bring along</strong></p> <ul> <li>BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science or related engineering discipline and 3+ years of industry experience.</li> <li>Experience creating system level software on Unix and/or Windows platforms. Windows programming experience would be great to have.</li> <li>Experience in Golang programming is a big plus, but not strictly required. Our team can teach you and get you up to speed.</li> <li>Strong experience having worked with C/C++ or other low level programming languages.</li> <li>Operational experience with monitoring systems would be very welcome.</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills, a great teammate with strong analytical, problem solving, debugging, and troubleshooting skills.</li> <li>Ability to work in a distributed team throughout the world.</li> <li>Knowledge and experience in Elasticsearch, Logstash, Distributed Systems is a plus.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Additional Information:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Competitive pay and benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices</li> <li>An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life</li> <li>Passionate people building great products</li> <li>Employees with a wide variety of interests</li> <li>Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.</li> <li>Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages! Some even fly south for the winter :)</li> </ul> <p>Please note, that\xc2\xa0we are looking for great talent across the globe and we will consider candidates that are not residing in the locations listed at the bottom of this posting.</p> <p>#LI-AC2</p> <p>Target locations: Amsterdam, The Netherlands; London, UK; Toronto, Canada; Austin, TX; Denver, CO;</p> <p>Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.</p> <p>\xc2\xa0</p>

or a software engineer with real interest, and ideally some experience, in Linux systems, networking, monitoring and automation.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">You have at least three years of experience using a public Cloud; AWS, GCP, Azure, Softlayer or OpenStack</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">You are comfortable writing software to automate API-driven tasks at scale. SRE use Python and Go regularly but are also encouraged to contribute to the product codebase in Java, Scala, and Python.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">You have used Ansible, Puppet, Chef or another config management suite, know where it's broken, and open to trying new alternatives</span></li> </ul> <p><strong>Key Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Healthy knowledge of Linux (have compiled your own kernel at some point, know how to trace syscalls, understand TCP, care about the difference between sysvinit/runit/systemd, etc.)</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Relentless desire to automate and build software tools</span></li> <li We make it easy for customers to use our products when deploying the Elastic Stack, either on our hosted service or on an infrastructure of their own choosing.</p> <p>Do you enjoy what you do? You\xe2\x80\x99re probably mentally editing this job posting.</p> <p>If you read this far and think, \xe2\x80\x9cThat's me!\xe2\x80\x9d then you probably won't need to read any further and we would love to have a conversation. such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Google Cloud Platform (GCP)</li> <li>Working knowledge of git and Github</li> </ul> <h3>Additional Information:</h3> <ul> <li>Competitive pay and excellent description: <h2>Security Risk and Compliance Analyst</h2> <p>Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, The New York Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 800 employees in more than 30 countries around the world.</p> <p>We are looking for a Senior Security Risk and Compliance Analyst to join the Information Security Team at Elastic. If you are someone that has a passion for the process of improvement, automation, and efficiency; and loves the fast pace of DevOps culture, then this is the job for you. This is a new role focused on developing and improving our internal risk &amp; compliance processes at Elastic primarily in the fields of information security and data privacy.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Audit and Compliance:</li> <li>Assess, formulate and monitor internal compliance requirements primarily in the fields of infoSec and data privacy in which you will work towards process efficiency and fit whenever possible.</li> <li>Manage audit requirements and deliverables for multiple compliance audits related to certification under various security standards (e.g. ISO 27001, SOC 2, etc.) and/or customer data privacy assessments (GDPR).</li> <li>Work on 3rd party risk assessments and compliance requirements for our vendor risk program and manage the review cycle.</li> <li>Assist with development and implementation of policies and procedures that align with ISO 27001 standards and with data processing standards applicable to Elastic\xe2\x80\x99s processing of personal data under GDPR.</li> <li>Work with stakeholders to coordinate remediation projects as required and report on progress to management.</li> <li>Customer interaction:</li> <li>Support potential clients and customers by answering inquiries about Elastic\xe2\x80\x99s data privacy and security and compliance practices.</li> <li>Coordinate responses to customer questionnaires by working with internal Elastic stakeholders.</li> <li>Optimize the program for efficiency.</li> <li>Work effectively with partners in IT, Finance, Legal, Engineering, and Product to assess security compliance requirements and recommend policies &amp; practices in support of the company\xe2\x80\x99s compliance initiatives.</li> <li>Demonstrate ability to engage at sufficient technical depth with our products.</li> <li>As a member of the InfoSec team, your position may include other responsibilities in the information security program such as assisting with vulnerability scan remediation, and updating risk assessments.</li> <li>Assist with coordinating security and privacy awareness training throughout Elastic.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p> <ul> <li>BA or BS or a higher degree in a technical field (e.g. EE, CS)</li> <li>2+ years experience working on compliance audits for SaaS platforms, including SOC 2 type 2 and/or ISO 27001.</li> <li>5 years of meaningful work experience across engineering and IT organizations, including security incident response, threat analytics, security operations, and security risk management.</li> <li>Working knowledge of common audit and compliance tools and requirements.</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to operate effectively at a dynamic company and embrace change.</li> <li>Technical aptitude and extreme attention to detail</li> <li>Excellent spoken and written communication skills</li> <li>Familiarity with GitHub</li> </ul> <p><strong>Preferred skills and experience:</strong></p> <ul> <li>CISA, CRISC, CISSP, CCSP, CIPP, or similar certification.</li> <li>Experience with Open Source and the Elastic Stack.</li> <li>Familiarity with cloud technologies (such as AWS, Azure, and GCP).</li> </ul> <p><strong>Additional</strong> <strong>Information</strong></p> <ul> <li>Competitive pay and benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices</li> <li>An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life</li> <li>Passionate people building great products</li> <li>Distributed-first company with employees in over 27 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages!</li> <li>Some travel may be required</li> </ul> <p>#LI-MD1</p> <p>Target locations: Washington D.C.; New York, NY; London, UK; Amsterdam, The Netherlands</p> <p>Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants We believe that diversity drives our vibe. We unite employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.</p> <h2>Kibana is the Window into the Elastic Stack</h2> <p>Kibana lets users visualize their Elasticsearch data and navigate the Elastic Stack, so they can do anything from learning why they\xe2\x80\x99re getting paged at 2:00 a.m. to understanding the impact rain might have on their quarterly numbers. Kibana gives users the freedom to select the way they give shape to their data. And they don\xe2\x80\x99t always have to know what they\xe2\x80\x99re looking for. With its interactive visualizations, users start with one question and see where it leads them. Kibana core ships with the classics: histograms, line graphs, pie charts, sunbursts, and more. They demonstrate the full aggregation capabilities of Elasticsearch.</p> <p>Kibana Canvas is a new data presentation, manipulation and communication application on top of Elasticsearch. Canvas is wildly flexible, enticingly extensible and plain fun to use. It\xe2\x80\x99s as beautiful as you make it and we want YOU to help make it more flexible, more beautiful and more fun.</p> <p>Are you a top Product Designer who want to add to Kibana Canvas? We want to meet you.</p> <h2>Engineering Philosophy</h2> <p>Engineering a highly complex distributed system that is easy to operate via elegantly designed APIs is a non-trivial effort. We also care deeply about giving you full ownership of what you\xe2\x80\x99re working on. Our company fundamentally believes great minds achieve greatness when they are set free and are surrounded and challenged by their peers, which is clearly visible in our organization. At Elastic, we effectively don\xe2\x80\x99t have a hierarchy to speak of. We feel that anyone needs to be in the position to comment on truly anything, regardless of his or her role within the company.</p> <h2>What You'll be Doing:</h2> <ul> <li>Provide product designs, prototypes and UX flows for the Kibana / UI team.</li> <li>Maintain our Sketch library and keep parity once your designs are coded.</li> <li>Provide design recommendations and support through code review for a large team.</li> <li>Provide iconography and illustration work as needed in your designs.</li> </ul> <h2>What You've Done:</h2> <ul> <li>5+ years of design experience working on complicated web applications or SaaS products.</li> <li>Experience with Sketch, specifically in the context of developing a design system.</li> <li>Facility with thinking in terms of systems, marked by an ability to make design decisions that scale and result in reusable patterns, palettes, and components.</li> <li>Considers how low-level design decisions affect the big picture and the future evolution of the UX.</li> <li>A positive attitude and a matching commitment to innovate</li> </ul> <h2>Bonus Skills:</h2> <ul> <li>The ability to code your designs in HTML and Sass or a similar preprocessor.</li> <li>General terminal and git/GitHub skills.</li> <li>Familiarity with JS frameworks like React or Angular.</li> <li>Some understanding of Dev ops, business analytics or security mindsets and needs.</li> <li>A love for animation. Familiarity with tools like Pivotal, Framer or CSS animations is a big advantage.</li> <li>Experience building accessible designs.</li> </ul> <h2>Additional Information</h2> <ul> <li>Deeply competitive pay, medical, dental, vision, disability, benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices</li> <li>An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life</li> <li>Passionate people building great products</li> <li>Employees with a wide variety of interests</li> <li>Your age is only a number. Today thousands of organizations like Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, NY Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. If you have a development background in both Ruby and Java, and find working on complex backend technology interesting, this could be the opportunity for you! You\xe2\x80\x99ll work with the Elastic Stack, and a broad variety of tools to solve problems for a diverse set of users and use cases.<br><strong><br>What You Will Do</strong></p> <p>Your main responsibilities in this position will be the creation and improvement of custom Logstash plugins and modules. A typical task might be the creation of a new plugin to integrate with a specific technology. This plugin would be built using either JRuby or Java. Another common task would be the creation of a Logstash module encapsulating configurations and dashboards for a given technology.</p> <p>Other common tasks pertain to our vast ecosystem of existing plugins, which we constantly work on to both maintain and improve. Tasks might include tracing a hard to find memory leak, researching more efficient ways to work with a given protocol, or building a new feature that our users want.</p> <p>Much of the work we deliver on Logstash and within the plugin ecosystem is open source. description: <div>At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects \xe2\x80\x94 Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats \xe2\x80\x94 we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.</div> <div> <p>With consulting engineers, solution architects and sales leaders distributed across 30+ countries, our Field Operations team brings incredible diversity to the work that they do every day. You are an experienced HR partner with a thirst for learning and curiosity to learn new technologies in support of this talented globally distributed cast of characters.</p> <p>You will work closely with our leaders to solve business challenges through people solutions, collaborating across boundaries and geographies and thinking differently about how we approach work and teams. Are you ready to roll up your sleeves and dig in? This will require you to think big, use data to drive strategy, challenge convention, and in some cases to reinvent how work is done (we have a LOT of time zones).</p> <p>Partnering closely with the VP of Global HR and the business, you will lead and influence all HR-related issues across our Field Operations Function (Sales, Sales Ops &amp; Strategy, Professional Services, Sales Engineering), including employee relations, compensation management, organizational planning, and employee engagement. As a team, we will:</p> <ul> <li>Provide insightful data to guide decision-making</li> <li>Drive business results and engagement metrics</li> <li>Lead functional and company-wide initiatives (e.g. performance feedback, manager development)</li> <li>Influence organizational change</li> </ul> <p>You thrive in ambiguity, adapt quickly to a changing environment, take a global view and have a passion for bringing people insights to the business. You know that sometimes laughter is indeed the best solution.</p> <h3><strong>Responsibilities</strong>:</h3> <ul> <li>Assist with the roll out of new initiatives and projects including compensation strategy, performance management, talent management, and career development</li> <li>Partner with leaders on performance management and compensation processes</li> <li>Assisting with other projects such as diversity, employee engagement and recognition programs</li> <li>Provide management coaching and training where needed to front line managers and senior leaders</li> <li>Use analytical capabilities to influence business partners with data-driven recommendations</li> <li>Partner with the business and HR leadership to influence Organizational Design</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree required; Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree or MBA a plus</li> <li>8+ years of progressively responsible experience in human resource management, especially in performance management, employee relations, and coaching with a Sales or Field Operations group</li> <li>Experience working in a global organization, some experience with a start-up environment preferred</li> <li>Strategic, critical thinker who isn\xe2\x80\x99t afraid to get into the weeds; real passion for problem solving</li> <li>Ability to build effective work relationships at all levels of the organization, influence behavior, and manage change</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills</li> <li>High degree of integrity and honesty; ability to exercise confidentiality and neutrality in complex and sensitive situations</li> <li>A sense of humor and ability to roll with the punches definitely a plus</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Additional Information:</strong></h3> <ul> <li class="li1">Competitive pay and benefits</li> <li class="li1">401(k) matching</li> <li class="li1">Stock options</li> <li class="li1">Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices</li> <li class="li1">An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life</li> <li class="li1">Passionate people building great products</li> <li class="li1">Employees with a wide variety of interests</li> <li class="li1">Distributed-first company with Elasticians in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages!\xc2\xa0</li> </ul> <p>Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.</p> </div>

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.</p>
title: Senior Product Marketing Manager - US or Europe

description: <p>At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects \xe2\x80\x94 Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats \xe2\x80\x94 we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 32 countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.</p> <p>We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a CISO for Elastic. This is a high visibility leadership role with a mandate to develop and lead information security policy, technology, and governance for our global operations. This position is responsible for setting information security strategy, policy, standards, and risk management processes for both internal Corporate IT and our Elastic Cloud SaaS offering.</p> <h2>Critical Responsibilities</h2> <ul> <li>Provide strategic leadership across the business to develop Elastic\xe2\x80\x99s information security program, leading the development, implementation, and maintenance of security policies, standards, and guidelines. The role will span corporate IT, security operations, privacy, and risk management.</li> <li>Identify Cloud-related security and compliance requirements, including developing short and long term roadmaps for regulations such as PCI/DSS, SOC2, HIPAA, FIPS, etc. Lead the company in driving our implementation of those requirements.</li> <li>Effectively work with partners in IT, Finance, Legal, Engineering, and Product, and demonstrate being able to engage at sufficient technical depth with our products</li> <li>Engage with Elastic\xe2\x80\x99s Sales organization and customers to share our approach to information security, listening and addressing concerns as appropriate</li> <li>Effectively communicate the importance of information security internally through enthusiastic security awareness and training</li> <li>Certify that security programs are in compliance with relevant international laws, regulations, and policies to minimize risk and audit findings</li> <li>Build the team for information security at Elastic. Define roles and responsibilities and hire as needed.</li> <li>Guide and promote a secure engineering function that builds cross-company tools for use by security operations and other teams. Support those teams in their adoption.</li> </ul> <h2>Required Skills and Experience:</h2> <ul> <li>Minimum 3 years of experience as an information security leader</li> <li>6+ years of experience in a medium to large technology company</li> <li>10 years of relevant work experience across product and IT organizations, including security incident response, disaster recovery, identity and access management, information privacy, security operations and security architecture.</li> <li>Experience with security and compliance issue related to cloud or SaaS services</li> <li>Experience implementing programs that help companies comply with regulations such as ISO, SOX, SOC, HIPAA, PCI, GDPR, FISMA, FIPS, and comparable US and international standards.</li> <li>Strong oral presentation and writing skills</li> </ul> <h2>Additional Information</h2> <ul> <li>Competitive pay and benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices</li> <li>An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life</li> <li>Passionate people building great products</li> <li>Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages! Some even fly south for the winter :)</li> </ul> <p>#LI-AC1</p> <p>Target Locations: San Francisco, CA; New York, NY; Chicago, IL; Boston, MA</p> <p>Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.</p>
title: Chief Information Security Officer

description: <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 80,000 members across 45 countries, and since its initial release. Elastic's products have achieved more than 225 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, </span><em><span style="font-weight: 400;">The New York Times</span></em><span style="font-weight: 400;">, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 800 employees in more than 34 countries around the world.</span></p> <p>Elastic is expanding its Sales Development Team to support the explosive adoption of our open source stack and our growing set of commercial products. \xc2\xa0The Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) play a critical role in developing the top of the sales funnel. \xc2\xa0The team\xe2\x80\x99s work focuses on engaging with our users to help them successfully navigate their Elastic journey and on generating new business opportunities for our experienced Sales Team.</p> <p>As an SDR, you will develop and foster a strong technical sales skill set, add immediate and direct value to our revenue growth, and have the opportunity to grow your career (in a variety of directions) at Elastic.</p> <p>Whether you just finished university or have several years of professional experience, we want people that are creative, passionate, and self-disciplined. \xc2\xa0You need to have that inherent competitive drive to be a top individual performer while collaborating and thriving within a team environment. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Most importantly, you want to be a part of something bigger than yourself. \xc2\xa0The use cases for Elastic\xe2\x80\x99s products are limitless, and the impact that our technology has on individuals and organizations is inspiring. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0We\xe2\x80\x99re building something special and sustainable here at Elastic.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Leverage best practices to develop your own strategy for prioritizing a high volume of inbound interest and appropriate follow-up</li> <li>Use Salesforce, social media/news, and prospecting tools to research accounts, identify key contacts and craft targeted messaging</li> <li>Communicate with a highly technical Elastic user community to understand their goals and challenges and effectively articulate our value proposition</li> <li>Collaborate with our Sales Team and other internal stakeholders to ensure alignment and constant refinement of best practices</li> <li>Consistently over-achieve monthly targets of quality opportunities that result in won business</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualities and Experience</strong></p> <ul> <li>You thrive in a fast-paced, open environment</li> <li>You\xe2\x80\x99re extremely bright and can quickly grasp and articulate new technologies</li> <li>You are genuinely curious, with an insatiable desire to ask questions and learn about a very technical product and audience</li> <li>You have been successful in a competitive, goal-driven environment</li> <li>Again, you are creative, passionate, and self-disciplined</li> </ul> <p><strong>Additional Information</strong></p> <ul> <li>Competitive pay and benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>401K</li> <li>Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages! Some even fly south for the winter :)</li> </ul> <p>Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. description: <p>\xc2\xa0</p> <p>At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects \xe2\x80\x94 Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats \xe2\x80\x94 we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.</p> <p>Thanks to our ongoing expansion, we have an opening for a dynamic Sales Incentives and Analytics Analyst to join our team. You will be a critical member of the Sales Strategy and Operations team who owns our monthly commissions' process across Global Field Operations. In addition, you will help support the design of our sales incentives, perform quota attainment reporting and forecasting, and help analyze relevant field performance measures.</p> <p>If you are passionate about using data to drive business results and you are looking for an opportunity with a dynamic, fast-paced organization, this could be a great fit.</p> <h2>Responsibilities</h2> <ul> <li><strong>Comp</strong> <strong>Administration:</strong> You will administer commission calculations on a monthly basis for the Field Ops organization (direct sales reps, channel / alliances, customer success managers, sales development reps, sales engineers, GTM leadership, professional services).</li> <li><strong>Incentive</strong> <strong>Analytics:</strong> You will own all monthly quota attainment-related critical metrics (e.g. quota attainment distribution / histogram, rep productivity, stack ranks, earnings attainment, etc.)</li> <li><strong>Executive</strong> <strong>Presentations</strong> <strong>/</strong> <strong>Rep</strong> <strong>Performance</strong> <strong>Reviews:</strong> You will present quarterly attainment and productivity reviews to the Chief Revenue Officer, SVP of WW Sales, and Area Vice Presidents.</li> <li><strong>Implement</strong> <strong>Early</strong> <strong>Warning</strong> <strong>Systems:</strong> You will actively lead field performance by forecasting attainment monthly and identifying areas for improvement (i.e. pipeline needs, conversion rates, renewal rates, etc). Provide recommendations, as needed, for mid-period incentives based on actual / forecasted results.</li> <li><strong>Incentive</strong> <strong>Design:</strong> You will develop recommendations that improve the structure and components of compensation plans across all functions within Global Field Ops. You'll also present final recommendations to our Chief Revenue Officer, SVP of WW Sales, Chief Finance Officer, and VP of Finance. Perform look back analyses to assess the effectiveness of our compensation plans.</li> </ul> <h2>Desired background</h2> <ul> <li>BS/BA required.</li> <li>1 to 2 years of work experience in Sales Compensation Administration, Sales Operations, Compensation Design, Compensation related Analytics, or similar field in SaaS organizations.</li> <li>Experience with the Xactly Incent compensation platform.</li> <li>Power user proficiency with the MS Office suite (especially MS Excel and MS PowerPoint). There will be an Excel Test as part of the interview process.</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, develop solutions, and craft recommendations and results into easily digestible messages, communications, and executive presentations.</li> <li>Very strong executive presence and engagement skills.</li> <li>Highly collaborative style with the ability to influence and to adjust on the fly to new demands with a sense of urgency.</li> <li>Ability to thrive in a dynamic start-up environment.</li> </ul> <p>#LI-MM1</p> <p>Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.</p>
title: Sales Incentives and Analytics Analyst

description: <p>At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects - Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats - we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 32 countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.</p> <p>To support our continued growth, we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a Sales Strategy and Operations leader for our Global Sales Strategy team. You will lead a team responsible for supporting each of our Area Vice Presidents globally and each of our Department Heads (e.g. Sales Development, Business Development, Customer Success, Professional Services, etc) within the Field Operations organization.</p> <p>You thrive in navigating ambiguity, adapt quickly to a changing environment, take a global view, are data-driven and have a passion for optimizing process and structure. You balance critical, long-term thinking about how we scale the business with hands-on delivery to ensure what needs to happen today gets done. You love leading a team and developing your people. You also love rolling up your sleeves and being an individual contributor. Driven by the results we deliver, we use all team members to execute efficiently and effectively. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for people with strong analytical and process skills, comfortable engaging with C-suite execs, effective at collaborating with multiple teams and building positive relationships with business partners.</p> <h2><strong>Responsibilities</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Guide, develop, and mentor a team responsible for providing strategic, operational, and tactical support to our global Go-to-Market Leadership team, consisting of: Direct Sales (Area Vice Presidents and Regional Vice Presidents), Head of Business Development, Head of Sales Development, Head of Customer Success, and the Head of Professional Services.</li> <li>Prepare monthly KPIs tailored to how local leadership prefers to track area, region, territory, and rep performance.</li> <li>Help oversee, prepare, and organize regional quarterly business reviews. This includes building templates, crafting the agenda, scheduling attendees, and gathering all metrics / performing all analysis needed for attendees to present their assessment of their business. Your team will also present an assessment of the business.</li> <li>Support the regional deployment of corporate objectives and programs to ensure cross-functional support and strategic alignment. Provide oversight to ensure corporate objectives are applied consistently and fairly while evening the needs of local markets.</li> <li>Drive and support semi-annual GTM planning, which includes headcount allocation and prioritization, capacity modeling, and developing regional financial plans that align to the overall corporate field operating plan.</li> <li>Deliver a monthly performance review deck to GTM leadership executives outlining MTD, QTD, and FYTD performance across a variety of measures by region and segment.</li> <li>Identify local demand gen signals and coordinate cross-functionally to address underlying blockers for growth.</li> <li>Determine territories for all GTM functions at the start of the fiscal year / fiscal half and support ongoing territory carving/assessments for every new hire throughout the year.</li> <li>Drive strategic initiatives including capacity planning, supporting ratio management (i.e. SEs, SDRs, etc), pipeline management and country-specific go-to-market plans.</li> <li>Work cross-functionally to develop growth plans for new geographies and market segments.</li> <li>Implement early warning systems to help actively manage the growth of the business (i.e. customer churn, pipeline, conversions, pricing, etc.).</li> <li>Support the weekly forecast calls for reps and leadership.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Desired</strong> <strong>background</strong></h2> <ul> <li>BS/BA required, MBA a plus, but not required.</li> <li>8+ years of experience in Sales Operations, Business Operations, Strategy, Sales FP&amp;A, Management Consulting, or similar field in SaaS organizations with strong exposure to go-to-market strategy.</li> <li>Experience forecasting bookings, rep attainment, and generally building complex and dynamic models for scenario planning.</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, develop solutions, and craft recommendations and results into easily digestible messages, communications, and executive presentations.</li> <li>Very strong executive presence and engagement skills.</li> <li>Highly collaborative style with strong influencing skills and the ability to adjust on the fly to new demands with a sense of urgency.</li> <li>Ability to thrive in a dynamic start-up environment.</li> <li>Experience with the Salesforce.com platform</li> <li>Power user proficiency with the MS Office suite (especially MS Excel and MS Powerpoint).</li> </ul> <p>\xc2\xa0#LI-AK1</p> <p>Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative description: <p><span style="font-size: small;">At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects \xe2\x80\x94 Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats \xe2\x80\x94 we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites 700+ employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.</span></p> <p><span style="font-size: small;">Thanks to our ongoing expansion, we are seeking a Territory Analyst to join our Sales Strategy &amp; Operations team. You will have a chance to create a broad set of expertise supporting our field operations organization in areas like territory management, data management, salesforce administration, and sales reporting.</span></p> <h1><span style="font-size: large;">Responsibilities</span></h1> <ul> <li>Data hygiene and enrichment: you will drive monthly, quarterly, and annual data-quality cleanup by conducting extensive account research, including market research and benchmarking.</li> <li>Become an authority in our data management tools, including Data.com, Clearbit, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator, along with regional research tools for our international teams.</li> <li>You will define and tune Elastic\xe2\x80\x99s industry taxonomy while teaming up with Marketing, Finance, and Product Management.</li> <li>Administer territories, roles, quotas, and forecasts in Elastic\xe2\x80\x99s Salesforce.com instance. You'll also provide ongoing support for these and other issues for Elastic's field operations team.</li> <li>Build a sales policy and process center of excellence by documenting and optimizing how we go to market.</li> <li>Participate in requirements\xc2\xa0gathering / feature\xc2\xa0testing on an as-needed basis for Salesforce.com enhancements related to data quality, territory routing, and our internal helpdesk.</li> <li>Participate in annual go-to-market planning, particularly in territory design, disruption analysis, and data enrichment (where needed).</li> </ul> <h1><span style="font-size: large;">Key Skills</span></h1> <ul> <li>1-3 years experience with strong working knowledge of Salesforce.com, Excel, and PowerPoint</li> <li>You have an ability to diagnose and troubleshoot issues with a customer-first, positive approach.</li> <li>You have strong interpersonal skills, and you're comfortable interacting with senior leaders.</li> <li>You're an excellent teammate, with the ability to work in a dynamic environment. You're more than capable of balancing your daily tasks along with major projects.</li> <li>You're self-motivated, able to work remotely and independently.</li> <li>Preferred: Salesforce Reporting &amp; Dashboard experience / ADM 101 Certification.</li> <li>Preferred: Experience as a business analyst, or in a sales strategy or sales operations role, particularly in the areas of territory management, reporting, or compensation administration</li> </ul> <h2><span style="font-size: large;"><strong>Additional</strong>\xc2\xa0<strong>Information</strong></span></h2> <ul> <li>Competitive pay, medical, dental, vision, disability, benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>401k</li> <li>Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices</li> <li>An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life</li> <li>Passionate people building great products</li> <li>Employees with a wide variety of interests</li> <li>Your age is only a number. As the company behind the popular open source projects \xe2\x80\x94 Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats \xe2\x80\x94 we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 32 countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.<br><br>We're scaling our Sales Engineering team and looking for great people to be technical liaisons for our Sales team. You will be helping us\xc2\xa0knock down the technical barriers to adoption of the Elastic stack and presenting our technology to help solve customers' mission critical business issues.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Engage with the Elastic Sales team in preparing and presenting the Elastic products while addressing any technical questions or concerns that come up during the sales cycle.</li> <li>Leverage your deep understanding of the Elastic products and technology to work closely with Engineering and Sales to resolve critical technical issues</li> <li>Provide customer and market feedback to the Product and Engineering teams and influence product direction</li> <li>Travel to prospective clients and build trust as a technical interface for them</li> <li>Continuously learn about competitive, complementary and emerging technologies and provide expertise positioning Elastic in this context</li> </ul> <p><strong>Requirements</strong></p> <ul> <li>2+ Years as a Sales Engineer</li> <li>Understanding of Open Source Big Data Technologies and knowledge and proficiency in at least one programming language</li> <li>Knowledge and deep understanding of distributed systems architectures</li> <li>Great presentation skills with the ability to speak in front of audiences both large and small</li> <li>Knowledge of Information Retrieval and/or Analytics domain</li> <li>Ability to travel at least 40% of the time</li> <li>Understanding of Linux, Java, and databases</li> </ul> <p><strong>Additional Information</strong></p> <ul> <li>Competitive pay and benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Catered lunches, snacks and beverages in most offices</li> <li>An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life</li> <li>Passionate people building great products</li> <li>Employees with a wide variety of interests</li> <li>Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages!\xc2\xa0</li> </ul> <p>#LI-BH1</p> <p>Elastic is an\xc2\xa0Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.</p> <div class="p-t-70 p-b-80">\xc2\xa0</div>

description: <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. title: Sales Director - Singapore

description: <p>At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects \xe2\x80\x94 Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats \xe2\x80\x94 we help people around the world do great things with their data. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.</p> <p>We\xe2\x80\x99re scaling our Government team and hiring for a SLED Sales Director covering our Central Region. Elastic\xe2\x80\x99s Public Sector team is dedicated to develop solutions tailored to our Government customer base.</p> <p>The first salespeople who sold paper and pencils, relational databases, and Hadoop did very well for themselves. Elastic is the next thing in data; we are rapidly growing and searching for a strong individual in Chicago or surrounding North Central market to help drive our business forward. Are you a creative sales person with ambition to develop new business in a dynamic market? Does learning new technology excite you? Do you have an optimistic vision for your future and inspire your colleagues, customers and business partners around you? Are you ready to take the next step in your sales career? We would love to have you join us for the ride.</p> <h2>Let's Talk if You:</h2> <ul> <li>Have 7-10 years of successful experience selling SaaS and/or open source software.</li> <li>Have 5+ years of experience selling into Central region State and Local government agencies and Education accounts with a comprehensive understanding of the local Public Sector landscape and associated business processes.</li> <li>Have knowledge of Big Data, Cloud, Systems Infrastructure, Enterprise Application Integration, Database and/or Data warehouse concepts and products.</li> <li>Are known for your operational excellence, ability to effectively utilize your own time, and are passionate about demonstrating the power of technology to do incredible work.</li> <li>Are consultative in relationships with your customers and have ability to establish trust.</li> <li>Can communicate with both developers and executives.</li> </ul> <h2>What You Will Do:</h2> <ul> <li>Lead your territory and grow your pipeline - identify prospects, diagnose needs, prescribe solutions, negotiate, and problem solve to build and meet Government customers\xe2\x80\x99 demand for Elastic\xe2\x80\x99s services.</li> <li>Position yourself as the industry authority and consultant to your partners and prospects by understanding their needs, enabling your customers to get business insights in real-time data exploration, and providing them with the most advanced open source search and analytics engine available.</li> <li>Collaborate with peers to develop fresh approaches, winning strategies, and champion sustained success.</li> <li>Drive new business and be a great partner within your region to customers by being an inspiring leader in your marketplace.</li> <li>Use SFDC to forecast activity and recurring monthly revenue achievement.</li> <li>Travel to meet customers or as business requires (30%).</li> </ul> <h2>Additional Information</h2> <ul> <li>Competitive pay, medical, dental, vision, disability, benefits</li> <li>401k plan</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Catered lunches, snacks and beverages in most offices</li> <li>An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life</li> <li>Passionate people building great products</li> <li>Employees with a wide variety of interests</li> <li>Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages! Some even fly south for the winter :)</li> </ul> <p>#LI-SP1</p> <p>Target Locations:\xc2\xa0 Chicago, Illinois; Columbus, Ohio; St. Louis, Missouri; Dallas, Texas</p> <p>Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.</p>
title: Sales Director - SLED

description: <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 80,000 members across 45 countries, and since its initial release. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, </span><em><span style="font-weight: 400;">The New York Times</span></em><span style="font-weight: 400;">, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 400 employees in more than 30 countries around the world.</span></p> <p><strong>Our Ideal Field Sales Candidate</strong></p> <p>You are an aggressive self-starter. You communicate an inspired and optimistic vision and win over colleagues, customers, and business partners alike with your effective communication skills. You are known for your strong prospecting capabilities, operational experience, ability to qualify opportunities, and effective time-management. You are constantly on the lookout for prospective deals and new business opportunities. You thrive in an independent role but also value collaboration. In addition, you have the following attributes:</p> <ul> <li>Deep understanding for how to leverage partners to build out a territory</li> <li>Ability to build consultative relationships with our customers and users to establish trust</li> <li>Ability to communicate our value proposition to Developers and Executives alike</li> <li>Innovative vision and foresight to anticipate and create new opportunities</li> <li>Solid ability to communicate with a Dev/Ops audience on a daily basis</li> </ul> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <p>You will develop and execute a strategic and comprehensive business plan for your territory, including identifying core customers and mapping the benefits of Elasticsearch solutions to the business requirements. You will strive to understand the customer\xe2\x80\x99s organizational structure and work to achieve alignment. You will take full responsibility for accurate forecasting, regular quarterly revenue delivery, and facilitation of sales enablement within your territory. Furthermore, you will coach partners, accessing resources within Elasticsearch to support them on specific opportunities, with the goal of building sufficient capacity to meet customers\xe2\x80\x99 demand for Elasticsearch-related services and skills.\xc2\xa0Other responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:</p> <ul> <li>Develop detailed sales/marketing plans and sales forecasts</li> <li>Manage time and work flow and create effective call plans</li> <li>Build an partner Eco-system that will drive success in the region</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications</strong></p> <ul> <li>7 \xe2\x80\x93 10+ years of successful enterprise software sales</li> <li> <div>7+ years experience with Public sector / Government</div> </li> <li> <div>Strong Public Sector ecosystem network</div> </li> <li>A proven track record of over-quota achievement</li> <li>Ability to operate in an entrepreneurial environment</li> <li>Knowledge of Big Data, Cloud, Systems Infrastructure, Enterprise application Integration, Database and/or Data warehouse concepts and products preferred</li> </ul> <p><strong>Additional Information</strong></p> <ul> <li>Competitive pay and benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>A fun environment to work hard and play harder</li> <li>Passionate people building great products</li> </ul> <p>Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.</p>
